title: Calories in Boba
meta_description: Discover calories in boba (bubble tea), including carbs, sugars, fat, protein, and tweaks for lower-calorie versions in this serving guide.
assumptions: Standard 16 oz (473 ml) milk-based bubble tea with black tea, tapioca pearls, moderate sugar syrup; no extra toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shop, size, milk type, sweetness level, and pearl quantity. Check labels or apps for custom orders.

quick_answer.text: One 16 oz serving of boba tea contains about 400 kcal, mostly from sugars and carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a standard boba tea?
faqs.a: About 400 kcal for a 16 oz serving with milk and moderate sugar.

faqs.q: Are boba pearls high in calories?
faqs.a: Yes, one serving of pearls adds ~100 kcal, mostly from carbs.

faqs.q: What's the sugar content in boba?
faqs.a: Around 50 g of sugars per 16 oz serving, mainly from syrup.

faqs.q: Can I make boba lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, skip pearls or reduce sugar to cut 100+ kcal; opt for unsweetened tea.

faqs.q: Does boba have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Low protein (~5 g) from milk; fat ~8 g, mostly saturated from dairy.
